page.title: 14Barnston, Lt Dunmow, Felsted
page.content:
A branch railway line between Braintree and Bishop's Stortford was built in 1864 and closed in 1952. This disused railway has since become a haven for wild-life and plants. Oak and Ash trees have grown along it and it has now been taken over by the Essex County Parks Department and is maintained by voluntary workers as a country walk.
The young river Chelmer flows through the area providing water meadows, pleasant walks and habitat for kingfishers, moorhens and herons. A small herd of deer occasionally wanders into fields around Barnston from nearby woodland.
